intro: Lisianthius pratensis, commonly known as the meadow lisianthus, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
